alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 11:17PM AKST until January 04 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER CONTINUES FOR THE FAR NORTHERN PANHANDLE... Our current system is tracking north across the Panhandle, with snow falling over the far north. Various reports of upwards of 6 to 8 inches snow for the Haines and Chilkat Peninsula area have been received as of 11 pm Wednesday with snow still falling moderately. As warmer air aloft is still expected to move into the north by early Thursday morning we are still expecting a period of a wintry mix and/or freezing rain for Haines. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Municipality of Skagway and the Klondike Highway. * WHEN...Through noon AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The greatest snow accumulations will be on the higher elevations of the Klondike Highway. The heaviest snowfall rates will occur Wednesday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
